subject: Re: [junit] Re: Thinking of improving the auto generation of test cases
msgSnippet: ... Mhh, I m not sure how allowing them to *not* write the tests first will help them come to value *writing* the tests first. It is also my experience that
messageBody:
junitheadache schrieb:
> it
> seems what people have problems with is the idea of writing the
> tests before writing the code. With that in mind, I figured if i
> could help autogenerate some basic testing codes to get them off on
> a start, they could get the hang of it and probably improve on the
> tests generated later.
>
> Erm does that make sense?

Mhh, I'm not sure how allowing "them" to *not* write the tests first
will help them come to value *writing* the tests first.

It is also my experience that the best way to learn TDD is to really
test and code in *very* tiny steps. Your proposed tool seems to
*increase* the size of the first step (generating a whole bunch of
assertions before writing the first production code), which seems to go
against the flow of TDD and I'd fear will in fact obscure the main
benefit of TDD - driving you to design your production code in mini steps.

I can imagine that going all those mini steps can feel tedious at the
beginning (although I don't remember having felt that way). I'm not sure
that taking a shortcut will help much with the learning, though. I'd
imagine that making those mini steps become *more fun* - perhaps by
making kind of game out of it - could be more effective...

Just my 0.02,

Ilja
